diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Cat scratch disease (encephalopathy associated with Bartonella henselae)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was based on the patient's acute encephalopathy following recent exposure to stray kittens, presence of inguinal lymphadenopathy, seizures, and characteristic findings on MRI indicating a localized process in the right hemisphere associated with Bartonella henselae infection. The serological testing confirmed high titers of IgG antibodies against Bartonella henselae, aligning with the clinical findings.
